<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong><em>Chutzpah</em> is a Yiddish term that roughly translates to "audacity" or "having the nerve to." It means you swerve left when society swerves right. Among my friends, I have a lot of chutzpah for using an Android phone that bombards their screens with green texts.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">This week, billionaire soccer club owners showed gobs of chutzpah when they attempted to upend decades of sporting tradition with their Super League. It collapsed within 48 hours.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But some big bets do pay off. Elon Musk's SpaceX, a company with the startling goal of "making life multiplanetary," sent four more astronauts to the International Space Station on Friday. Which just goes to show, a little chutzpah can go a long way. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal</p>
</div>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with... Cameo CEO Steven Galanis
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis-7e88" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photograph of Cameo CEO Steven Galanis. He has short cropped hair and a dark beard and is wearing a light orange t-shirt. He is sitting in front of a desk with a laptop, screen, and microphone in front of a grey stone wall." style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODM4L3N0ZXZlbl9nYWxhbmlzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Cameo</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Social media completely changed how celebrities interact with their fans. But until recently, that relationship was still largely a one-way street. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Enter Cameo.</strong> This four-year-old company lets fans commission videos from their favorite influencers. Now, Gilbert Gottfried can roast your bff. Kevin from <em>The Office</em> can wish your mom a happy birthday. Snoop Dogg can order your students to read their syllabus. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The Brew <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interviewed</a> Cameo cofounder Steven Galanis about his path to becoming the CEO of a billion dollar company and the new game of fame.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You started Cameo while still working at LinkedIn. What was the "aha" moment when you knew you were ready to go full-time?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I was sitting in a hot tub in Nicaragua New Year's Day of 2017. I was on the trip with a bunch of people I worked with at LinkedIn. I had spent the last three months telling everyone about the idea, and people were really excited (a lot of those people work for Cameo now). One of the guys goes, "Steven, this idea is too big. If you never leave LinkedIn and somebody else builds this and becomes a billionaire, could you live with yourself?" </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">And the answer was no. My brain chemistry changed that day, and I just knew I had to go and pursue this. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Could Cameo be a platform where someone gets their start, or will you always need an established presence first? </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I think people can blow up on Cameo and become sensations there. I don't think we can take you from zero to one, but I think we could take you from one to 10.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who is your dream Cameo?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I grew up as a hockey player. I'm from Chicago, and my idol growing up was Eddie Belfour, who was the Blackhawks goalie when I was a kid. Eddie the Eagle would be my dream Cameo.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>If you could live in the setting of any book or movie, what would it be?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I'm Greek, and when the Cameo funding got announced, the mayor of Sparta sent me an official proclamation inviting me to come back to my dad's hometown to celebrate the 2,500th anniversary of Sparta's victory over Persia at the Battle of Thermopylae. So I would probably love to be one of the 300 Spartans that fought.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>If you could collect any random object with no limit, what would you collect?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I love sports paraphernalia. I collect a lot now—this even predates Cameo and I think it's one of the reasons I got into it. I love things like, "This was the basketball that Michael Jordan shot the last time he played a game."</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>To hear about the biggest career mistake Galanis made, where NFTs fit into Cameo, and more, </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>check out our full interview</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse" width="100%">
<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px">
<a rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none" target="_blank" href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F25%2Ficebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis-7e88" class=""><img style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/3/p/605cd938b510b.png">
</a><span> </span>
<a rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Cameo+has+completely+changed+how+celebrities+and+fans+interact.+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis-7e88&via=MorningBrew" class=""><img style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k5/3/p/605cd97454214.png">

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Through Instacart, personal shoppers deliver fresh groceries and other essentials to you in as fast as one hour. </strong>So whether you’re busy meal planning or have a hankering for three pounds of kumquats (because why not?), you can get <a href="https://www.instacart.com/?utm_source=instacart_brand&utm_medium=partner_email&utm_campaign=dailybrew&utm_content=morningbrew&utm_term=primary_delivery_apr25" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all of your grocery needs with unrivaled speed</a>.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Instacart gives you time back in your day. That means when you do yoga, spend time with family, or try a new hobby (perhaps a kumquat still life), your groceries will be taken care of by a shopping extraordinaire. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">You can even chat with your shopper while they fill your cart, so if kumquats are running low, they’ll let you know the next best option (we’re thinking clementines). </p>

WORK LIFE
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Freedom of Curls
</h1>
<img alt="Make It Work logo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Hi Kate! I'm a Black woman and entrepreneur, but given the past year's difficulties, I'm contemplating going back to the workforce. I've been my own boss for years now, so my question is this...do I need to go back to "corporate friendly" hairstyles during my interview? I really don't want to give up my freedom of curls, but also know that it unfortunately matters upon first impressions. —Nia in Tampa Bay</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hell naw, Nia! Yes, I know that you reaaally want to land a job. But please remember that you are also "dating" these companies to see if they are worthy of landing <em>you</em>! If an employer cannot handle the hot fire that's on your head then they don't deserve you, sis. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">For the people in the back, that means a hairstyle that may be but is not limited to: natural curls, relaxed hair, colored hair, a buzz cut, gorgeous locks, a laid frontal with 24-inch middle part weave (iykyk), or the old faithful doobie. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">As a Black professional myself, I have had my own share of anxiety when looking for jobs. I felt this unspoken pressure to present my work aesthetic a certain way to seem "approachable" to future employers. But at some point in my career, I grew mentally tired of that and decided I will no longer try to appease employers based on what others may think is "professional." When I made that decision, I started interviewing and didn't land <em>a</em> job but <em>THE</em> job that fit me perfectly. I switch my hairstyle probably every two months and absolutely no one makes weird comments or makes it a point of discussion at the beginning of Zoom meetings. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>I am too handsome at work. How do I solve this? —Silly</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Wear a mask.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source%3Dmorning_brew&source=gmail&ust=1619297949945000&usg=AFQjCNEmnZGXCm0dMxk6HLMfzyPy-hd1mw" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Kate for advice here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"></p>

<tr>

<tr class="">
<td align="left" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; word-break: break-word;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">
<tr>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffe62e 25%, #0f9046); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The $0 Blockbuster
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Perhaps no image captures the preposterousness of the last year for movie theaters than the box office chart for June 10, 2020. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODUyL2JveF9vZmZpY2VfbW9qby5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Box Office Mojo</em> </small></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">On that day, a Wednesday, a movie called <em>Unsubscribe </em><a href="https://patch.com/new-york/westhampton-hamptonbays/how-filmmaker-got-1-movie-america-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped the US charts</a> with $25,488 in gross earnings, beating out several other movies that were shown at drive-ins. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Like dogecoin, <em>Unsubscribe</em> started out as a joke and eventually became a real thing. When theaters were shut down last spring, two former BuzzFeed employees, filmmaker Christian Nilsson and YouTuber Eric Tabach, looked at the box office charts and saw movies were making the leaderboard with miniscule ticket sales—$9,000 here, $15,000 there. </p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1">
<span>"Nothing big was coming out. Blockbuster films were on hold. I wanted to find a way to get the biggest number," Tabach </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53099283?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the BBC</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">Look...if you had one shot...or one opportunity….</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">With Christopher Nolan and Michael Bay mostly out of the picture because of the pandemic, Nilsson and Tabach devised a plan to conquer the box office. They shot the 30-minute horror movie on Zoom with an official budget of $0.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Then, for the movie to actually generate ticket sales, they rented out a local movie theater, the Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center in Long Island, in a process known as "<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/may/22/four-walling-obscure-films-directors-pay-screen?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four-walling</a>." Four-walling is essentially the self-publishing of the film world—you pay to rent out a theater but get to keep all the proceeds yourself.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">No one attended the movie besides Nilsson and Tabach, but after <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/06/19/880964044/a-clever-hack-that-sent-a-29-minute-horror-movie-to-the-top-of-the-u-s-box-offic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three screenings</a> of <em>Unsubscribe</em>,<em> </em>they managed to pay enough money to themselves for the movie to top the box office.</p>
<h2 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">The big picture</h2>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Tonight, the Academy Awards will be held for the first time since February 2020, when <em>Parasite </em>director Bong Joon Ho stole the show with his pledge to drink "until the next morning." </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">A lot has changed since then—<a href="https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/beyond-oscars-glitz-movie-theaters-face-uncertain-future-2021-04-21/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">none of it great</a> for theaters. </p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>Studios found success releasing films simultaneously in theaters and on streaming services. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>The theatrical window, a Hollywood tradition that had allowed theaters to show movies for months before other platforms got their turn, is collapsing. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Up to a quarter of total screens in the US could go dark in the next few years, per some estimates.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Movie theater bears say the pandemic simply accelerated the demise of big screens by a few years. Hollywood bulls say to look at the recent box office success of <em>Godzilla vs. Kong</em>—nothing can replace the feeling of watching two monsters go at it with Dolby surround sound and 300 people gasping at the same time. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">One thing's for sure: As charming a story as it is, if a movie like <em>Unsubscribe </em>tops the box office again, something will have gone very, very wrong. </p>

</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome back to the Brew's version of Zillow surfing: Open House. This week, we're heading to a place where realtors consider everything "spacious" and crown molding is a replacement for a full-size oven—that's right, New York City. We'll give you a few facts about a listing and you'll try to guess the price. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">  <img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ZvfCaygAyLoIzippRS/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>StreetEasy</em> </small> </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Today's <a href="https://streeteasy.com/building/the-remsen/4b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apartment</a> is a...spacious one bed, one bath in a pre-war 10-story Brooklyn Heights building. Some amenities include:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>A full-time doorman and a working elevator</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Original cork floors</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Updated kitchen with questionable backsplash</span></li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>A teeny-tiny little bathroom hallway to your toilet</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much for this apartment to live your big city dream?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">$699,000</p>

Among my friends, I have a lot of chutzpah for using an Android phone that bombards their screens with green texts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThis week, billionaire soccer club owners showed gobs of chutzpah when they attempted to upend decades of sporting tradition with their Super League. Cameo CEO Steven Galanis\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis-7e88\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A photograph of Cameo CEO Steven Galanis. He has short cropped hair and a dark beard and is wearing a light orange t-shirt. He is sitting in front of a desk with a laptop, screen, and microphone in front of a grey stone wall.\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODM4L3N0ZXZlbl9nYWxhbmlzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eCameo\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSocial media completely changed how celebrities interact with their fans. But until recently, that relationship was still largely a one-way street. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEnter Cameo.\u003c/strong\u003e This four-year-old company lets fans commission videos from their favorite influencers. Now, Gilbert Gottfried can roast your bff. Kevin from \u003cem\u003eThe Office\u003c/em\u003e can wish your mom a happy birthday. Snoop Dogg can order your students to read their syllabus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe Brew \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterviewed\u003c/a\u003e Cameo cofounder Steven Galanis about his path to becoming the CEO of a billion dollar company and the new game of fame.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou started Cameo while still working at LinkedIn. What was the \"aha\" moment when you knew you were ready to go full-time?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI was sitting in a hot tub in Nicaragua New Year's Day of 2017. I was on the trip with a bunch of people I worked with at LinkedIn. I had spent the last three months telling everyone about the idea, and people were really excited (a lot of those people work for Cameo now). One of the guys goes, \"Steven, this idea is too big. If you never leave LinkedIn and somebody else builds this and becomes a billionaire, could you live with yourself?\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAnd the answer was no. My brain chemistry changed that day, and I just knew I had to go and pursue this. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCould Cameo be a platform where someone gets their start, or will you always need an established presence first? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI think people can blow up on Cameo and become sensations there. I don't think we can take you from zero to one, but I think we could take you from one to 10.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho is your dream Cameo?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI grew up as a hockey player. I'm from Chicago, and my idol growing up was Eddie Belfour, who was the Blackhawks goalie when I was a kid. Eddie the Eagle would be my dream Cameo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIf you could live in the setting of any book or movie, what would it be?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI'm Greek, and when the Cameo funding got announced, the mayor of Sparta sent me an official proclamation inviting me to come back to my dad's hometown to celebrate the 2,500th anniversary of Sparta's victory over Persia at the Battle of Thermopylae. So I would probably love to be one of the 300 Spartans that fought.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIf you could collect any random object with no limit, what would you collect?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI love sports paraphernalia. I collect a lot now—this even predates Cameo and I think it's one of the reasons I got into it. I love things like, \"This was the basketball that Michael Jordan shot the last time he played a game.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eTo hear about the biggest career mistake Galanis made, where NFTs fit into Cameo, and more, \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/icebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003echeck out our full interview\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F25%2Ficebreakers-cameo-ceo-steven-galanis-7e88\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nFreedom of Curls\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make It Work logo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80Njg5L21ha2VfaXRfd29ya19sb2dvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/fY1CGzyY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHi Kate! I'm a Black woman and entrepreneur, but given the past year's difficulties, I'm contemplating going back to the workforce. I've been my own boss for years now, so my question is this...do I need to go back to \"corporate friendly\" hairstyles during my interview? I really don't want to give up my freedom of curls, but also know that it unfortunately matters upon first impressions. —Nia in Tampa Bay\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHell naw, Nia! Yes, I know that you reaaally want to land a job. But please remember that you are also \"dating\" these companies to see if they are worthy of landing \u003cem\u003eyou\u003c/em\u003e! If an employer cannot handle the hot fire that's on your head then they don't deserve you, sis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFor the people in the back, that means a hairstyle that may be but is not limited to: natural curls, relaxed hair, colored hair, a buzz cut, gorgeous locks, a laid frontal with 24-inch middle part weave (iykyk), or the old faithful doobie. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAs a Black professional myself, I have had my own share of anxiety when looking for jobs. I felt this unspoken pressure to present my work aesthetic a certain way to seem \"approachable\" to future employers. But at some point in my career, I grew mentally tired of that and decided I will no longer try to appease employers based on what others may think is \"professional.\" When I made that decision, I started interviewing and didn't land \u003cem\u003ea\u003c/em\u003e job but \u003cem\u003eTHE\u003c/em\u003e job that fit me perfectly. I switch my hairstyle probably every two months and absolutely no one makes weird comments or makes it a point of discussion at the beginning of Zoom meetings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eI am too handsome at work. How do I solve this? —Silly\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWear a mask.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23486973.16825/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77C474a70d2?utm_source%3Dmorning_brew\u0026source=gmail\u0026ust=1619297949945000\u0026usg=AFQjCNEmnZGXCm0dMxk6HLMfzyPy-hd1mw\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Kate for advice here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F23%2Fmake-work-freedom-curls\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;\"\u003e\n \n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"column\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe $0 Blockbuster\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003ePerhaps no image captures the preposterousness of the last year for movie theaters than the box office chart for June 10, 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODUyL2JveF9vZmZpY2VfbW9qby5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eBox Office Mojo\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOn that day, a Wednesday, a movie called \u003cem\u003eUnsubscribe \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://patch.com/new-york/westhampton-hamptonbays/how-filmmaker-got-1-movie-america-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped the US charts\u003c/a\u003e with $25,488 in gross earnings, beating out several other movies that were shown at drive-ins. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eLike dogecoin, \u003cem\u003eUnsubscribe\u003c/em\u003e started out as a joke and eventually became a real thing. When theaters were shut down last spring, two former BuzzFeed employees, filmmaker Christian Nilsson and YouTuber Eric Tabach, looked at the box office charts and saw movies were making the leaderboard with miniscule ticket sales—$9,000 here, $15,000 there. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"Nothing big was coming out. Blockbuster films were on hold. I wanted to find a way to get the biggest number,\" Tabach \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53099283?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the BBC\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eLook...if you had one shot...or one opportunity….\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWith Christopher Nolan and Michael Bay mostly out of the picture because of the pandemic, Nilsson and Tabach devised a plan to conquer the box office. They shot the 30-minute horror movie on Zoom with an official budget of $0.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThen, for the movie to actually generate ticket sales, they rented out a local movie theater, the Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center in Long Island, in a process known as \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/may/22/four-walling-obscure-films-directors-pay-screen?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour-walling\u003c/a\u003e.\" Four-walling is essentially the self-publishing of the film world—you pay to rent out a theater but get to keep all the proceeds yourself.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eNo one attended the movie besides Nilsson and Tabach, but after \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/06/19/880964044/a-clever-hack-that-sent-a-29-minute-horror-movie-to-the-top-of-the-u-s-box-offic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethree screenings\u003c/a\u003e of \u003cem\u003eUnsubscribe\u003c/em\u003e,\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003ethey managed to pay enough money to themselves for the movie to top the box office.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:18px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003eThe big picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eTonight, the Academy Awards will be held for the first time since February 2020, when \u003cem\u003eParasite \u003c/em\u003edirector Bong Joon Ho stole the show with his pledge to drink \"until the next morning.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eA lot has changed since then—\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/beyond-oscars-glitz-movie-theaters-face-uncertain-future-2021-04-21/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enone of it great\u003c/a\u003e for theaters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStudios found success releasing films simultaneously in theaters and on streaming services. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe theatrical window, a Hollywood tradition that had allowed theaters to show movies for months before other platforms got their turn, is collapsing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUp to a quarter of total screens in the US could go dark in the next few years, per some estimates.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eMovie theater bears say the pandemic simply accelerated the demise of big screens by a few years. Hollywood bulls say to look at the recent box office success of \u003cem\u003eGodzilla vs. Kong\u003c/em\u003e—nothing can replace the feeling of watching two monsters go at it with Dolby surround sound and 300 people gasping at the same time. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOne thing's for sure: As charming a story as it is, if a movie like \u003cem\u003eUnsubscribe \u003c/em\u003etops the box office again, something will have gone very, very wrong. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F04%2F23%2F0-budget-movie-topped-pandemic-box-office\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
